titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Oversize Ms. Codex 720: Lectura super capitali Firmiter credimus

availability.licence: These images and the content of Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts Oversize Ms. Codex 720: Lectura super capitali Firmiter credimus are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. See the Creative Commons Public Domain Mark page for usage details, http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/mark/1.0/.

notesStmt.note: Incipit: Lectura de summa trinitate. Firmiter credimus et simpliciter confitemur fidem (f. 1r).

Explicit litteratura capitali firmiter de summa trinitate et fide Catholica completa in studio Bononiensi et per Coradum de Solto sacrae theologiae doctorem atque professorem. Anno domini millesimo trezentesimo octoagesimo octavo decima nona die Aprilis (f. 103r).

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Unpublished work in four parts; topics include the nature of faith, the Trinity, God, Adam, Eve, demons, angels, baptism, and the Eucharist; with a register of questions (contents) with page numbers, on preliminary folios [iii-vi].

supportDesc.extent: 112 leaves : 290 x 204 (183 x 140) mm. bound to 309 x 211) mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, 112; [vi], 1-68, [i], 69-77, [i], 78-103, [i]; contemporary or near contemporary foliation in ink, lower right recto.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 2 columns of 39 lines; ruled in lead.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a cursive humanistic script by 2 hands.

binding.p: 19th-century calf over old wooden boards (Zacour-Hirsch); back board is split, weakened by worm damage.

origin.p: Written in Bologna, Italy, dated April 19, 1388 (f. 103r).

history.provenance: Formerly in the library of the Dominican convent of St. Augustine at Padua.
Sold at auction at Hoepli, 3 Dec. 1929 (catalog, p. 33) to E. P. Goldschmidt; appears in Goldschmidt's catalog 23 (1930), no. 101.
